15.4. Multilayer Perceptron Model 300
 n batch: The number of samples to include in each mini-batch (e.g. 32).
 n diff: The diﬀerence order (e.g. 0 or 12).
Modern neural networks can handle raw data with little pre-processing, such as scaling and
diﬀerencing. Nevertheless, when it comes to time series data, sometimes diﬀerencing the series
can make a problem easier to model. Recall that diﬀerencing is the transform of the data such
